Class Triangle

java.lang.Object
  Triangle
public class Triangle
extends java.lang.Object

A triangle that can be manipulated and that draws itself on a canvas.

Version:
1.0 (15 July 2000)
Author:
Michael Kolling & David J. Barnes (modified by: C. Singer)

Constructor Summary
Triangle()
          Create a new triangle at default position with default color.
 
Method Summary
 void changeColor(java.lang.String newColor)
          Change the color.
 void changeSize(int newHeight, int newWidth)
          Change the size to the new size (in pixels).
 void erase()
          Erase the triangle on screen.
 int getXPosition()
          Returns the x coordinate of the top vertex of the triangle.
 int getYPosition()
          Returns the y coordinate of the top vertex of the triangle.
 void makeInvisible()
          Make this triangle invisible.
 void makeVisible()
          Make this triangle visible.
 void moveDirection(int xDistance, int yDistance)
          Move in the direction defined by xDistance and yDistance

Constructor Detail

Triangle

public Triangle()
Create a new triangle at default position with default color.

Method Detail

changeColor

public void changeColor(java.lang.String newColor)
Change the color. Valid colors are "red", "yellow", "blue", "green", "magenta" and "black".

changeSize

public void changeSize(int newHeight,
                       int newWidth)
Change the size to the new size (in pixels). Size must be >= 0.

erase

public void erase()
Erase the triangle on screen.

getXPosition

public int getXPosition()
Returns the x coordinate of the top vertex of the triangle.

getYPosition

public int getYPosition()
Returns the y coordinate of the top vertex of the triangle.

makeInvisible

public void makeInvisible()
Make this triangle invisible. If it was already invisible, do nothing.

makeVisible

public void makeVisible()
Make this triangle visible. If it was already visible, do nothing.

moveDirection

public void moveDirection(int xDistance,
                          int yDistance)
Move in the direction defined by xDistance and yDistance
